arts.ttl: Brentford 1-0 Aston Villa: Keith Andrews 'proud' as Dango Ouattara debut goal earns first win of the season
arts.sum: Bees bounce back from opening day defeat to Nottingham Forest

arts.ttl: Keith Andrews expresses love for 'Brentford-like performance' after 'gutsy' win over Aston Villa
arts.sum: Andrews was rewarded for his decision to start club-record signing Dango Ouattara a week after his £37 million plus add-ons arrival from Bournemouth as he scored the match-winning goal in the first half. Keith Andrews expressed his love for a " Brentford-like performance" that secured him his first competitive win as a head coach after a 1-0 triumph over Aston Villa at the Gtech Community Stadium.

arts.ttl: Keith Andrews proud as Brentford pick up first win of season against Aston Villa
arts.sum: Dango Ouattara hit the winner on his debut following a club-record £42.5million move from Bournemouth.

arts.ttl: Brentford backline brilliance gives new boss Andrews victory over blunted Villa
arts.sum: Keith Andrews earns his first Premier League points with Brentford in a hard-fought 1-0 win over Unai Emery's Aston Villa at the Gtech Community Stadium on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Dango Ouattara sees off Aston Villa as Brentford give Keith Andrews first win
arts.athr: Ben Bloom at the Gtech Community Stadium
arts.sum: Two concerned sets of fans descended on west London on Saturday after what they had witnessed from their respective teams on the opening day of the season. Now there is one. Never before had Brentford played a competitive match at the Gtech Community Stadium without Thomas Frank at the helm, and there are bound to be doubts over his unlikely successor Keith Andrews. This lion-hearted win over European-standard opposition deserves to allay a fair portion of them. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Dango Ouattara scores only goal as Brentford edge past Aston Villa
arts.sum: The winning goal came early in the first half.
